alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:34PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...DRY MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN LOS ALAMOS, SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 632 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong microburst winds along a line extending from near San Ysidro to Eldorado At Santa Fe. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, White Rock, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Jemez Springs, San Ysidro, Cerrillos Hills State Park, Canada De Los Alamos, Glorieta and Jemez Pueblo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 255 and 302. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 282 and 290. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 13 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
